intro: Fadogia coriacea, commonly known as African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It has a fibrous root system and can grow up to 2 meters in height. Fadogia coriacea is also known for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
